alert.note: Alert for Juncos; Las Piedras; Naguabo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 6:30PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Juncos, Las Piedras and Naguabo. * WHEN...Until 730 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM AST, emergency management reported heavy rain in Vitinas sector of Rio Blanco due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Vitinas sector of Rio Blanco is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Piedras, Naguabo, Juncos, La Fermina, Roosevelt Roads, Pena Pobre, Rio Blanco, Pueblito Del Rio, El Mango, Duque, Lomas and Daguao. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
